Comment:
This was a ladder game where I was challenged by a player with a considerably higher rating. From my perspective the result was a good one but I'm still not sure if I should have carried on the game for a little longer.

We start with my favored English opening. I decided to go for this as I know it better than most openings
The computer calls this a mistake preferring cxd5 Nxd5. My intention was to make the position more complex

The three black pawns on the c file certainly cheered me up and gave me hope that this wouldn't be the decimation I expected at the beginning of the game

At the time I thought this was the only way to prevent the loss of a pawn but the computer calls it a mistake preferring 12. bxc3 Rb8 13. Rd1 Nxc3 14. Bxc6+ Ke7 though I don't understand the suggestion of Rb8 in preference to say Nxc3.

At the time I thought this was the only way to prevent the loss of a pawn but the computer calls it a mistake preferring 12. bxc3 Rb8 13. Rd1 Nxc3 14. Bxc6+ Ke7 though I don't understand the suggestion of Rb8 in preference to say Nxc3.

I don't like this move in this position, all it does is force me to move the rook which I was inclined to do anyway. My plan now was to prevent black from castling with Ba3 which will be hard to extricate

Would Re1 have been any better? I think with hindsight it would have been

At this point black suprised me a little by offering a draw which I gladly accepted, the question is, should I have carried on a little longer?
